result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw

records.addlTxt: TURN OVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT. UPON PLACEMENT BAIL TO CONVERT TO $250.00 PR BOND WITH TURNOVER TO JUSTICEPOINT.

Defendant Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Case DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel advises Court that defendant has been accepted into Drug Treatment Court.  Court will schedule status conference in this court after intake in Br. 21.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is eligible for DTC. Case adjourned for entry on 7/13/2022 at 3:00, in branch 21.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceedings. 
Defense advises the Court he was recently retained and infroms the court the defendant has a pending matter with Judge Wagner. Defense further advises the case may go to drug treatment court. 
Court authorizes transfer to Judge Wagner if accepeted. Court orders matter adjourned for status. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will adjourn case to allow PDs office additional time.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Pretrial conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court adjourns for a status of counsel on May 04, 2022 at 08:30am in Br. 30.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with All Macy's stores in Milwaukee County, and all their employees.

Defendant Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kelvin Lamar Crenshaw appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22 @ 2:30p
